alert.note: Alert for West Slopes North Cascades and Passes; West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes; West Slopes South Central Cascades and Passes (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 2:58PM PST until January 06 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON PST THURSDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow continued. Additional snow accumulations of up to 7 inches. Freezing rain is also possible at Snoqualmie Pass Thursday morning. * WHERE...Cascade mountains and valleys of Whatcom and Skagit Counties, including the Mount Baker Ski Area. The Cascade mountains and valleys of Snohomish and King Counties, including Stevens and Snoqualmie Pass and Cascade mountains and valleys of Pierce and Lewis Counties, including the Crystal Mountain Ski Area and Paradise on Mount Rainier. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 1 PM Wednesday to noon PST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Major travel delays possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.
